Sequence Information.Peptide Name: EAFP1 (Eucommia antifungal peptide 1, natural AMPs;  UCSS1a; 5S=S, XXQ, BBS, plants)

Literature Information.Literature: The N-terminus of the peptide is blocked by pyroglutamate. This is the first finding of a plant antifungal peptide with a five-disulfide motif. The five S-S bonds are C1-C5, C2-C9, C3-C6, C4-C7, and C8-C10. EAFP1 and EAFP2 show characteristics of hevein domain and exhibit chitin-binding properties similar to the previously identified hevein-like peptides. They exhibit relatively broad spectra of antifungal activities against eight pathogenic fungi from cotton, wheat, potato, tomato and tobacco.
Literature Information.Author: Huang RH, Xiang Y, Liu XZ, Zhang Y, Hu Z, Wang DC.2002
Literature Information.Title: Two novel antifungal peptides distinct with a five-disulfide motif from the bark of Eucommia ulmoides Oliv.
